item.description: Apple Dog Blues, take one, an original song by Ron Stephens ;-))

item.title: The Future of Religion
item.description: The Future of Religion and the Baha'i Faith

item.title: Strong Deism, Time Revisited, and Reality
item.description: Strong Deism, Time Revisited, Reality and Creating God.

item.title: Time Out of Mind
item.description: Time is an interesting phenomenon investigated by Amit Goswami, Paul Davies, Frank J. Tipler, Rupert Sheldrake, Roger Penrose and Ron Stephens ;-))).

item.title: An Interview with Eric Sandmeyer
item.description: An interview with Eric Sandmeyer, a.k.a. Aikidog.

item.title: The Indic Civilization
item.description: A look at the ancient Indic civilization of Harrappa, Mohenjo-Daro and Mehrgahr.

item.title: Paranormal
item.description: The world is stranger than is dreamt of in your philosophy, Horatio. Cellular membranes, zero point fields, quantum and paranormal phenomena.

item.title: An Interview with Rob Walch of Podcast411
item.description: An interview with Rob Walch, the popular host of Podcast411, about religion, spirituality and science, and the impact of advancing technology on human culture, society, and philosophy. This is another interview in the Spirit and Millennium series.

item.title: Yoga
item.description: Yoga is a 4000+ year old technology for being human.

item.title: Millennial religion, high touch technology, and passionate science.
item.description: Millennial religion, high touch technology, and passionate science.

item.title: the Artist formerly known as Cat Stevens
item.description: The Artist formerly known as Cat Stevens has released "An Other Cup" under the name "Yusuf" as in Yusuf Islam. It's pretty good!

item.title: Spirit and Millennium: an Interview wtih Robin Maiden
item.description: Is God dead? is Richard Dawkins right in his new book "The God Delusion"? Would we better off with no religious beliefs? This is an interview with Robin Maiden of the Insytworks podcast at www.insytworks.com in which we explore these important issues.

item.title: Thanksgiving
item.description: Thank God for the mysteries.

item.title: Beer and Tea
item.description: Beer is the basis of Western Civilization going back to the Sumerians who used beer in religious rituals in their sacred brothels; but beer has some unfortunate side affects (that some see as features ;-)) Chinese and Indian Civilization have roots in the more healthful beveridge, tea, and it is the glories of tea that I come to extoll in this podcast.

item.title: Reunion
item.description: Upon attending the 35'th reunion of the Amelia (Ohio) High School Class of 1971, I reconnect with the importnace of friendship, then I attended a Bob Dylan concert in Cooperstown NY in the baseball stadium on September 2, in the remnants of Ernesto.

item.title: Bob Dylan
item.description: An overview of the life and career of Bob Dylan, nee Robert Zimmerman, in preperation for the release of his next album, Modern Times, on August 29, 2006.

item.title: AwareTek VideoCast and ArtBlog
item.description: Announcing the All New AwareTek VideoCast and ArtBlog!

item.title: New Technology, New Directions
item.description: New technology and new directions for AwareTek

item.title: Ten Consents
item.description: Ten Consents, towards building a consensus for the new global age, a podcast by Ron Stephens of the AwareTek podcast series, www.awaretek.com.

item.title: Changing Times
item.description: The times they are a changing, and you don't need a weatherman to know which way the wind is blowing. It is an inconvenient truth that the earth is warming due to increasing CO2 concentrations in the atmosphere. Ground Zero is still embroiled in controversy. Strange days indeed...

item.title: Heirarchy, Transcendence, Reality
item.description: The Door to the Future

item.title: The Gift of the Magi
item.description: The Gift of the Magi and the real Da Vinci Code are revealed in this podcast

item.title: Special
item.description: What makes life special? A philosophical discourse, inspired by listener feedback, and the last in a series of such, before a move in a whole new direction for the AwareTek podcast series.

item.title: The Da Vinci Code Movie
item.description: A review.

item.title: Why I am a Baha'i
item.description: Why I am a Baha'i...a postmodern journey to faith at the dawn of a new millennium.

item.title: God is dead. Long live G_d.
item.description: God is dead. Long live G_d. The Great Transformation, by Karen Armstrong is about the Axial Age and got me to thinking. This podcast is the result.

item.title: Personal Technology
item.description: Mac OS X dual booting and virtualization technology; GPS navigation systems; and XM satelite radio

item.title: Roots
item.description: A remembrance of things past in the podcasting community, a walk down memory lane, and a celebration of one full year of the AwareTek podcast series.

item.title: Free Will
item.description: Free Will and its Discontents...

item.title: Mash-Up
item.description: An AwareTek Mash-Up

item.title: An Interview of Brian Wallace
item.description: An interview with author Brian Wallace

item.title: Encore
item.description: Life is like a Book, an episode in an on-going podcast experiment

item.title: Top Ten Predictions for 2006
item.description: AwareTek's Top Ten Predictions for 2006 in four categories: Politics and World Events, Economics and Finance, Art and Culture, and Science and Technology.

item.title: A Tale of Two Cities
item.description: A Tale of Two Cities, the best of times, the worst of times: we stand poised delicately between a great economy and dramatic economic problems, good and evil, and war and peace. Ray Kurzweil's Singularity stands opposed to the apocalyptic visions of others. The Baby Boom Generation nears retirement.

item.title: Self
item.description: Self, consciousness, survival, life after death, eternity, what is eternal?

item.title: Panspermia
item.description: Panspermia, a theory originally proposed by Anaxagoras in classical Greece, is the theory that life originated elsewhere and subsequently seeded earth with life. Revived by Francis Crick, the scientist who decoded DNA, it is recieving increasing credence

item.title: Ben Bernanke named Chairman of Federal Reserve
item.description: Ben Bernanke has a perfect resume to be the most powerful man in the world

item.title: Bleeding Purple
item.description: Leif Hansen's Bleeding Purple's Angels, Aliens, and Artificial Intelligence Interview with Ron Stephens is recommended at www.wonderosity.org . Also, Dolly Parton, Madonna's Isaac Luria song, and Anne Rice' Out of Egypt.

item.title: Art and Evolution
item.description: Evolution of emotions and art, hobbits, Ray Kurzweil, Neanderthals, and spindle cells.

item.title: Top Ten People of the Twentieth Century

item.description: Very Short podcast about psychic phenomenon along with various announcements and comments.

item.description: MetaReligion includes the core beliefs of all the major religions

item.title: Extropianism
item.description: Extropianism refers to the technological enhancement of human beings, physically, mentally and spiritually. This is as guest podcast by Daryl Fallin.

item.title: Native Spirit
item.description: Native American Indians contributed much to the American way of life and spirit

item.title: Changes
item.description: Changes in my personal life reflect larger changes in the podcasting community which in turn reflect still greater changes in the world at large.

item.title: Personal
item.description: Personal history, Moses Stephens through Cumberland Gap, Elsie Vanover nee Crabtree, etc.

item.title: Awaretek Analog
item.description: The real world is analog, not digital, nominalist, not platonic, inductive not deductive, sort of ;-))). Piezoelectricity, frequency control and itmin using quartz devices.

item.title: Awaretek Unix
item.description: Unix is a family of computer operating systems that offers unity in diversity. The basic philosophy is that software tools should be small, modular and do one job really well, while interfacing well with other tools and systems. This philosophy is also great for business, where we need more competition and less monopoly.

item.title: Awaretek VirtualReality
item.description: Virtual Reality is about our need to transcend our current reality, especially our communications capabilities. Alternate realities are illustrated using whales, dolphins, hammerhead sharks, and especially cephalopods, which include octopi, squids and cuttlefish.

item.title: Awaretek Feedback
item.description: AwareTek July 24 2005, "Feedback" from listereners, Sufi teachings, Africa, dreams, humanity as a transitonal state, Music, Bach, Beethoven, Mozart, art of the future.

item.title: Awaretek Zoroaster
item.description: Zoroaster was a prophet born around 1000 BC who has influenced Judaism, Christianity, Islam and Buddhism, as well as modern philosophy.
